SENT.plain: A 41-year-old woman has had a long history of repeated episodes of recurrent painful ecchymotic lesions
Results of coagulation tests were normal other than a slight decrease in antithrombin III
Skin tests were positive in response to the patient's own washed red cells
Light and electron microscopy of both the spontaneous and the induced lesions showed nonspecific changes but failed to reveal immunologic vasculitis
Psychologic evaluation showed hysterical and masochistic traits, depression, anxiety, and inability to deal appropriately with hostile impulses
Placebo was successful on several occasions in controlling or modifying the severity of the ecchymotic lesions
